link.title: COVID-19 UPDATES | Mount Pleasant, TX - Official Website

meta.name: description
meta.content: Get the latest COVID-19 updates for Titus County

p.span: - Increase your productivity, customize your experience, and engage in information you care about.

img.alt: COVID-19 Landing Page Get the latest updates

div.p:
Click on the title to view the full article and bookmark this page for easy access.
Use the links on the left to visit COVID-19 Response Partners.

p.strong: ACTULIZACIONES MAS RECIENTES PARA LA CIUDAD DE MOUNT PLEASANT
p.br: Haga clic en el título para ver el artículo completo y guarde esta página para acceder fácilmente. Use los enlaces a la izquierda para más información de otras identidades sobre COVID-19.

div.class: inner col col24 first last id0f9f2aff-5d3a-42db-a3b9-d3c30fb54861

li.div: During his press conference today, Governor Abbott stated that there are nearly 500,000 job openings in Texas and referenced this site for starting your search... Read on...
City/County to provide free hand sanitizer to individuals & retailers, available while supplies last. Read on...

While the number of COVID-19 positive cases in Titus County is low compared to other regions, they ARE increasing. To slow the spread, County Judge Brian Lee will amend the current Local State of Disaster Declaration for the county on Monday, April 20. Read on...

Even in the best of times, First Responders are prepared for the worst. So it’s no surprise how our Mount Pleasant Police Department, Fire Department and EMTs are serving the local community during this global pandemic. Read on...

We thank every resident and each business in Mount Pleasant for doing your part to flatten the curve in our hometown during this global pandemic. We are truly experiencing a time of sacrifice personally, professionally and economically that is... Read on...

Social distancing orders prohibiting gatherings of 10+ apply to your home as well as public places (even during the Easter Holiday weekend). Gatherings of 10+ are a Class B Misdemeanor and subject to a $1,000 fine or 180 days in jail. Read on...

Beginning tomorrow at 2 p.m., the 1897 Titus County bell in Downtown Mount Pleasant Bell Tower will ring to call residents "together" for prayer or reflection on behalf of our healthcare workers and first responders on the frontline of COVID-19. Read on...

h4.a: WEAR A MASK WHEN YOU LEAVE HOME | 04/07/20 |

li.div: The CDC is strongly encouraging you to wear a mask anytime you leave your home. If you have not been able to obtain surgical masks or N95 masks for yourself and your family, the CDC is recommends the use of cloth face coverings. Read on...

h4.a: HOW YOU CAN HELP PROTECT OUR FRONT LINE | 04/04/26 |

li.div: Titus Regional Medical Center is accepting donated face masks to supplement the shortage of supplies for our healthcare workers and First Responders. This is a great STAY HOME, STAY SAFE project for your household. Read on...

Heroic efforts are being made by Titus County school boards, administrators, faculty and staff to keep students learning, fed and feeling connected to their schools here at home during a global incident. Read on...

Titus County Judge expanded the current Local State of Disaster Declaration for the county, which covers Mount Pleasant. The declaration took effect Thursday, April 2. It will be in effect until further notice. Here is an explanation for what you CAN do. Read on...

Titus County Judge Brian Lee today expanded the current Local State of Disaster Declaration for the county, which covers all cities including Mount Pleasant. The declaration includes additional measures that take effect 12:01 a.m., Thursday, April 2. Read on...

You must assume that the COVID-19 virus is already in our community. Yet we continue to see groups of people gathering around town. THIS MUST STOP, TO SLOW THE SPREAD OF THE VIRUS. Please practice social distancing. Read on...

Do not give out your PayPal account information, Social Security number, bank account number or anything else if someone claims such information is essential to sign you up for a stimulus check relating to the COVID-19 pandemic. Read on...
Provides direct help to Texans: Allots $1,200 checks to each taxpayer making less than $75,000 annually ($2,400 for a couple making less than $150,000 annually), plus $500 per child... Read on...
The Countywide Emergency Management Team continues to hold daily conference calls to share important information. Here’s what you need to know... Read on...

City Council renewed and continued the Declaration of Local Disaster and Public Health Emergency related to COVID-19 last night during an emergency meeting. The declaration will remain in effect until terminated by a vote of the City council. Read on...
During these challenging times, you can take confidence in the City of Mount Pleasant’s water supply and the nation’s supply chain... Read on...
The CDC has provided an online COVID-19 Symptoms Self Check tool. The purpose of the Coronavirus Self-Checker is to help you make decisions about seeking appropriate medical care. Read on...

Due to UNNECESSARY HOARD-BUYING and the temporary shortage of toilet paper, there has been an increase in the sale of flushable wipes and other alternative paper products. But these wipes are not really flushable and create problems with the sewer sys... Read on...

The Texas Department of Public Safety (DPS) is extending the expiration of a Texas I.D. card, driver license, commercial driver license, commercial license permit or election identification certificate... Read on...

h4.a: MESSAGE FROM TITUS COUNTY JUDGE BRIAN LEE | 03/22/20 |

li.div: We are all living in a very different reality in the midst of a global pandemic. This is something every citizen and business in Titus County must take seriously. An Emergency Response team consisting of leaders throughout the county including... Read on...

Texas officials have issued a statewide public health disaster declaration, in the latest effort to combat the spread of COVID-19. Texas Gov. Greg Abbott made the announcement at the Capitol today. Read on...

The Public Library will be closed until further notice in response to updated Federal guidelines to help mitigate the spread of the Novel Coronavirus. The library will offer an alternative “curbside” pick-up service to make every effort to... Read on...

The City has issued an update on the Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) and its impact on city facilities following the declaration of a national state of emergency by President Trump and a state of disaster for Texas by Governor Abbott. Learn More...

UPDATE ON NOVEL CORONAVIRUS (COVID-19): LIBRARY PROGRAMS CANCELLED. The City of Mount Pleasant has cancelled all programs and activities at the Mount Pleasant Public Library through April 30. At this time, the library remains open. Read on...
